meanings.definition: Scatter or spread (things) untidily over a surface or area.
meanings.sent1: Leaves were strewn across the yard after the windstorm.
meanings.sent2: She strewn flower petals along the aisle for the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel strewn acorns all over the picnic blanket.
meanings.sent4: Memories of the past were strewn like fallen leaves in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully strewn paint across the canvas, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The strewn toys in the playroom made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The strewn papers on the desk needed to be organized.
meanings.sent3: The strewn leaves in the yard looked like a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent4: The strewn clothes on the floor gave the room a messy appearance.
meanings.sent5: The strewn shells on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.
